title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Create a simple game difficulty selector!

1. Create an int variable 'level' and set it to any number
2. Use if-else if-else to display messages:
   - If level == 1: 'Easy mode selected'
   - Else if level == 2: 'Normal mode selected'
   - Else if level == 3: 'Hard mode selected'
   - Else: 'Invalid level! Defaulting to Normal.'

Try changing the level value to test all paths!

hints.text: Use == to compare (not =). Chain them: if (...) { } else if (...) { } else if (...) { } else { }
Using = instead of == for comparison: level = 1 ASSIGNS 1, level == 1 COMPARES!
Forgetting that only ONE block runs: If score is 95, only the 'A' grade displays. The others are skipped!
Putting else if AFTER else: The final else must be LAST! else if after else causes an error.
Wrong order of conditions: If you check score >= 70 BEFORE score >= 90, a score of 95 will hit 'C' first and stop!
